items.title: MaxRL: Maximum Likelihood Reinforcement Learning with 20x Test-Time Scaling Efficiency

content.abstract: Maximum Likelihood Reinforcement Learning (MaxRL) demonstrates superior scaling with increased computational resources, achieving up to 20x test-time scaling efficiency on mathematical reasoning benchmarks compared to existing methods.

items.title: SWE-Universe: 800,000 Real-World Software Engineering Environments

content.abstract: Alibaba's Qwen Team developed SWE-Universe, a framework creating over 800,000 real-world software engineering environments. Qwen3-Max-Thinking model achieves 75.3% accuracy on SWE-Bench Verified, demonstrating significant advancement in automated software engineering.

items.title: PixelGen: Pixel-Space Diffusion Achieving FID 5.11 on ImageNet-256

content.abstract: PixelGen, a pixel-space diffusion model, achieves higher fidelity than state-of-the-art latent diffusion models, obtaining FID of 5.11 on ImageNet-256. Challenges the dominance of latent diffusion approaches.

items.title: WideSeek-R1: Width Scaling for Broad Information Seeking via Multi-Agent RL

content.abstract: WideSeek-R1 explores width scaling for broad information seeking via multi-agent reinforcement learning, demonstrating new approaches to multi-agent coordination and information retrieval.

items.title: From Assumptions to Actions: LLM Reasoning into Uncertainty-Aware Planning

content.abstract: Paper accepted to ICLR 2026 presents framework turning LLM reasoning into uncertainty-aware planning for embodied agents, bridging language understanding with physical world interaction.

items.title: LLM Game-Theoretic Reasoning: How Far from Professional Poker Players?

content.abstract: Examines LLMs' game-theoretic capabilities through poker domain, revealing significant gaps between LLM reasoning and professional-level game-theoretic decision making.

items.title: Unmasking Reasoning Processes: Process-aware Benchmark for Mathematical Reasoning in LLMs

content.abstract: Introduces process-aware benchmark for evaluating structural mathematical reasoning in LLMs, providing deeper insights into how models approach multi-step mathematical problems.

items.title: Review of Superconducting Qubit Devices and Large-Scale Integration

content.abstract: Comprehensive review of superconducting qubit quantum computers as leading architecture for large-scale integration. Covers proposals and developments for scaling superconducting quantum systems.

items.title: Enabling Large-Scale Digital Quantum Simulations with Superconducting Qubits

content.abstract: Digital quantum simulation using quantum computers to replicate behavior of other quantum systems could enable studying intractable problems, transforming quantum chemistry, condensed matter physics, and materials science.

items.title: Computer Science Challenges in Quantum Computing: Early Fault-Tolerance and Beyond

content.abstract: Quantum computing entering period where progress shaped by computer science advances as much as hardware improvements. Early fault-tolerant QC shifting bottlenecks to system design and integration.

items.title: QRC-Lab: Open-Source Framework for Quantum Reservoir Computing

content.abstract: Introduces QRC-Lab, open-source Python framework bridging theoretical quantum dynamics and applied machine learning workflows. Quantum Reservoir Computing emerges as paradigm for noisy intermediate-scale quantum ML.

items.title: NorwAI's Large Language Models: Technical Report for Scandinavian NLP

content.abstract: NorLLM team at NorwAI develops family of models for Norwegian and Scandinavian languages, building on GPT, Mistral, Llama2, Mixtral and Magistral architectures to address underrepresented language NLP.

items.title: LLM-based Embeddings: Attention Values Encode Sentence Semantics Better

content.abstract: Shows attention value vectors capture sentence semantics more effectively than hidden states for deriving sentence representations in LLMs, challenging conventional embedding extraction methods.

items.title: Data Augmented Pipeline for Legal Information Extraction and Reasoning

content.abstract: Pipeline leveraging LLMs for data augmentation in legal information extraction tasks. Demonstrates domain-specific LLM applications for law and legal reasoning.

items.title: Vision-Language Action Models: Distracting Token Pruning for Robotic Manipulation

content.abstract: Introduces Distracting Token Pruning (DTP) framework for Vision-Language Action models to improve attention to task-relevant regions, enhancing task success rates in robotic manipulation.

items.title: Integrated Exploration and Manipulation on Scene Graph with LLM Replanning

content.abstract: Accepted by ICRA 2026. Presents integrated exploration and sequential manipulation using scene graphs with LLM-based situated replanning for embodied agents.

items.title: HoRD: Humanoid Control via Reinforcement Learning with Hierarchical Policy

content.abstract: Advances humanoid robot control through reinforcement learning with hierarchical policy design. Addresses challenges of complex, high-dimensional humanoid locomotion and manipulation.

items.title: MoRo: Generative Masked Modeling for Human Motion Reconstruction

content.abstract: MoRo addresses human motion reconstruction from video through generative masked modeling, designed to handle occlusions in real-world robotic applications.

items.title: Beyond Visual Realism: Toward Reliable Financial Time Series Generation

content.abstract: Accepted by ICASSP 2026. Addresses reliability in financial time series generation beyond visual similarity, with implications for ML in finance.

items.title: Deep RL for Optimum Order Execution: Mitigating Risk and Maximizing Returns

content.abstract: Applies deep reinforcement learning to optimum order execution in trading, balancing risk mitigation and return maximization for algorithmic trading strategies.

items.title: Martingale Optimal Transport: Dual Attainment for Multi-Asset, Multi-Period

content.abstract: Establishes dual attainment for multimarginal, multi-asset martingale optimal transport problems, extending results to arbitrary numbers of assets and time periods with financial applications.

items.title: Algorithmic Coupling in US Banking: AI-Driven Decision Synchronization Risks

content.abstract: Presented at ASSA 2026. Examines how US banking system is becoming algorithmically coupled through synchronized AI-driven decision-making, creating implications for systemic financial risk.

items.title: Quantum Computing for Climate Modelling: Opportunities and Challenges

content.abstract: Explores how quantum computing could improve climate projections from Earth system models, with potential to address uncertainties in subgrid-scale processes like turbulence and convection.

items.title: ML-Physics Fusion Models for Typhoon Forecasting

content.abstract: Develops ML-physics fusion models for improved typhoon forecasting, combining data-driven approaches with physical constraints for extreme weather prediction.

items.title: Continuous Decline of Land Carbon Sink During Recent Climate Events

content.abstract: Documents continuous decline of land carbon sink during recent extreme climate events, with implications for carbon cycle modeling and climate projections.

items.title: Adaptive Quantum-Safe Cryptography for 6G Vehicular Networks

content.abstract: Accepted at NDSS 2026. Presents adaptive quantum-safe cryptography for 6G vehicular networks via context-aware optimization, addressing emerging mobility security needs.

items.title: Privacy-Preserving Multi-Client Data Sharing via Consensus-Based Distribution

content.abstract: Secure, verifiable, and scalable multi-client data sharing via consensus-based privacy-preserving data distribution, combining cryptography with distributed computing principles.

items.title: Tri-LLM Cooperative Federated Zero-Shot Intrusion Detection

content.abstract: Tri-LLM cooperative federated zero-shot intrusion detection with semantic disagreement and trust-aware aggregation for security in distributed ML contexts.

items.title: From Consensus to Chaos: Vulnerability Assessment of RAFT Algorithm

content.abstract: Examines vulnerabilities in RAFT distributed consensus algorithm, revealing potential attack vectors in widely-used distributed systems.

items.title: Enterprise Quantum Readiness: Less Than 5% Have Formal Transition Plans

content.abstract: Survey reveals fewer than 5% of enterprises have formal quantum-transition plans, while post-quantum cryptography is widely recognized as primary path for cybersecurity applications.

items.title: Social Network Analysis via Graph Neural Networks: Misinformation Detection

content.abstract: Applies graph neural networks to social network analysis for improved misinformation detection, addressing growing concern about information integrity.

items.title: Value Alignment in Large Language Models: A Multi-Stakeholder Perspective

content.abstract: Examines value alignment in LLMs from multi-stakeholder perspective, addressing ethical implications and governance challenges of AI systems.

items.title: AI Safety Benchmarks: Comprehensive Evaluation Framework for Risk Assessment

content.abstract: Proposes comprehensive AI safety benchmark framework for systematic risk assessment, enabling standardized evaluation of model safety properties.

items.title: Explainable AI for Healthcare: Interpretable Diagnostic Models

content.abstract: Develops explainable AI methods for healthcare diagnostic models, balancing predictive accuracy with interpretability for clinical decision support.

items.title: Federated Learning for Privacy-Preserving Medical AI Across Institutions

content.abstract: Advances federated learning methods for privacy-preserving medical AI across healthcare institutions, enabling collaborative model development without data sharing.
